comments:
I have a requirement to use a date range i.e., Start Date and End Date as input parameters. If the start date is given and the end date is given as null, the output appears as expected because the null condition check is done in tha parameter binding section. But, I still see the followinf Exception trace at the end of the desired output.

Can you please help me on this? Is this a known issue ?

There are errors on the report page:

Created an attachment (id=49458)
here is the attachment

The bug is caused by a Rhino problem. In the report the value of expression "params["ReportParameterEnd"] == null" should be true. But the value evaluated by Rhino is false. I have submit a bug to Rhino project. The URL is https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=351526.
In 'params["ReportParameterEnd"] == null', what is the value evaluated from 'params["ReportParameterEnd"]'? Is that a "null" string or null value?

We talk with engine team. The report parameter objects always exist after definded. The value of report parameter can be gotten through 'params["ReportParameterEnd"].value'. That mean the expression 'params["ReportParameterEnd"] == null' always equal false in Birt. The right expression is 'params["ReportParameterEnd"].value == null'.

traces.message: Default value for input parameter cannot be null.
